greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of [n] cyclically avoiding the consecutive step pattern UDU (U=up, D=down).
link: Alois P. Heinz and Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..460 (first 200 terms from Alois P. Heinz)
example: a(2) = 0 because 12 and 21 do not avoid UDU (the two U's overlap).
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(t=4, 0,
mathematica: a /@ Range[0, 30] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 19 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 02 2013
